data.title: Listen - Shannon RFC 4 in a Row Documentary in full
data.meta_description: Live 95 Sport aired the concluding segment of our special documentary celebrating 30 years of AIL rugby on the Saturday Morning Sports Show.
data.text:
Live 95 Sport aired the concluding segment of our special documentary celebrating 30 years of AIL rugby on the Saturday Morning Sports Show.

The documentary focused on the competitions most successful club Shannon RFC and their famous four AIL titles in a row in the mid-90's.

AIL rugby was king in those days as teams littered with provincial and International stars graced club rugby venues up and down the country on a weekly basis.

Interest levels were at an all time high following the introduction of the competition in 1990.

Cork Constitution were the inaugural winners of the trophy but the rest of the decade would be dominated by Limerick clubs.

Shannon RFC watched on in the early years while local rivals Young Munster and Garryowen landed the coveted prize.

That was until the 94/95 season when a team led by head coach Niall O'Donovan and captain Pat Murray finally ended their wait for AIL glory.

That win would prove to be the spark that saw the birth of a dynasty and a famous and unprecedented four AIL titles in a row.

Listeners will hear contributions from famous club men, past and current club presidents and players such as Mick Galwey, Marcus Horan, John Leahy, Vinny Ryan and Billy Oâ€™Shea.

Many thanks to all at Shannon RFC and in particular Club PRO Katie McCloskey.

Part 3 as aired on Saturday Morning.
